Params: Capt., look! It's the beach! A beach that's just like the holos!
Yo... Wazzat in the distance? Is that a beach chair?
A place like this actually exists in the world...
The giant building behind encircles the beach and the sea. A silence takes over.
The slightly salty sea breeze blows the whimsical waves at you, causing droplets to fizzle on your face. It reminds you that this is not a holo-movie in Babylonia, but a place that physically exists.
And the fine sand beneath your feet too, seeps slowly into your tactical boots from your weight, scratching your instep.
So this must be what Celica meant by a "vacation"... I think I'm starting to look forward to it.
The beach and the sea breeze... It does make one want to wind down...
Hnnh, why... do I feel kinda sleepy?
Hm... Probably an automatic response of our human-simulation modules... Commandant, can you help me turn it off?
It's a vacation, though, Lucia. Don't you plan on relaxing a little?
Being seen through, Lucia suddenly begins to feel at loss.
...I'm just worried that there might be combat, from what happened earlier.
While Lucia was talking, Liv has snuck around to the shallow waters behind Lucia and launched a handful of water at her.
I'm doing what they call a "water fight" back in the Golden Age. Lucia, join me!
The two girls step into the shallows and start splashing water at each other...
Don't say I didn't warn you two when salt crystallizes in your joints... You'll have to pop them open for maintenance...
With Lucia and Liv in the lead, Sophia and Ayla also joins in the water fight.
Karenina was the last to join, but she laid waste to the most targets.
...Nobody had the slightest clue that her bazooka could fire water.
How much time has passed before today...?
You feel like you have been battling for a long, long time.
At that thought, you cannot help but look to the side...
...And see Kamui trying to use his Big Kamui as a... surfboard?!
Chrome is trying to stop Kamui from doing so, but to little success.
...And look at Kamui now all drenched. No way Big Kamui can float.
Speaking of, where is Liv and Lucia...?
You've been lying on the beach for a while. You might catch a cold.
I feel pretty okay and comfortable.
Why don't you guys join me?
...The surrounding temperature is indeed quite pleasant. I guess you'll be fine.
You hear sand shuffling—likely Lucia and Liv sitting down beside you.
If there comes a day, when the battle against the virus is finally over...
What will become of you, and us?
There might be new battles to be fought, still.
I guess we'll all return to our daily lives.
That honestly makes me a bit mixed up.
But no matter where we are, or who we serve...
I am forever your blade, and this will never change.
And we fight... so that there will come a day where no one has to anymore.
So Commandant, if the day comes when you don't have to battle anymore... How would you like to live? I think Ayla mentioned that you have potential as an artist.
Will there finally be peace...? I surely hope so.
When the virus is gone, along with the threat of the Corrupted...
The things mentioned in the database about the Golden Age... Shopping malls, summer breaks, social networks—they will all come back, right?
...How would you like to live, then, Commandant?
Would you like to study? Or work? If Ayla is right, you might have the potential to be an artist too!
If Ayla's saying , she must have her reasons.
I'm also looking forward to what you will paint with a brush.
They say that in the age with no holos or tactile sensory simulations, people relied on paintings to preserve their special moments.
If it's you, Commandant... I do look forward to seeing what you might paint.
Come to think of it, I haven't had much opportunity to think about the future before.
Same here. Our future... I wonder what it'll be like?
At the very least, one will never find an answer about the future from the F.O.S. instructors.
After a nigh-eternity and countless sacrifices, counterattack is finally on the horizon for Babylonia.
Until the final victory, everyone in Babylonia will gladly burn themselves up to end this war. It is the case for this generation. It is the case for the generations to come.
Only when the Punishing Virus ceases being a threat to humanity, will the sacrifices end.
As for what comes in the day after... No one, not the President, nor the instructors, have spoken on the matter.
Though, what Lucia mentioned are not things of the "future," but things of the "past."
The Golden Age that is lost forever... The more one thinks about this...
Commandant? You've been silent for a while now.
You stay silent, and Lucia knows not to probe as well.
But, not everyone has Lucia's delicacy...
Sorry, I tried telling Kamui to not disturb your rest...
Haha, see! Commandant is okay with it!
That doesn't mean you should.. But well, I do admit I am quite curious about what you were discussing.
Seeing the growing commotion, the others also gather around you...
What comes after victory...? Indeed, I've never thought about it before.
But when we finally get rid of the virus, then does that mean Asslam can stop?
We can do what Princess Jamilah said, and find some place full of trees and water...
...And live like our ancestors. We can build a home, brick by brick. We can all eat together.
Will such a future really come?
...No, I shouldn't doubt. I believe what you say, Commandant.
Why is everyone all gathering around here?
We are all talking about the future.
Lee my bro, you slow, man! We're talking about what will happen after the virus is gone!
I'm not your bro...! After the virus is gone?
That's indeed our ultimate goal, but I... never envisioned what we would do after that.
Yeah, after we became Constructs, a natural lifespan no longer means anything to us.
Theoretically, everyone can live until victory comes, except...
...You feel the gazes of everyone trained on you.
...Just to get this serious atmosphere out of the way.
What are you all on about?
I'm just trying to live until I can collect my pension.
Weeell! Commandant's been through so much with us already!
I believe 100% in you, my good comrade!
...Yeah, the operations on Earth is progressing smoothly. The establishment of safe zones is, at least, not a fantasy.
...But let's get back to the topic and think about what happens after that.
Well well, talking about the future? How can you not consult Ayla, the one who knows the Golden Age database inside out!
What's in store?! What's in store?! Do I get to drown myself in games after the virus kicks it?!
You... might actually be able to.
With the game industry production capacity in the Golden Age... Kamui, you might indeed have enough games to last you until the heat death of the universe...
Ugh, there'll probably be a bazillion different things that the engies will have to rebuild. All of a sudden, I'm not looking forward to it.
Kamui, please think about it more seriously...
What about you, Lee? When that time comes, what would you like to do?
Me...? Never thought about it before.
If you ask me, though, then it'd be nice if Murray can quit working at Babylonia and stop living a life with danger always lurking around the corner...
Nah, but not exactly, though. Murray is working for Babylonia because he wants to.
You heard me—never thought about it... It'd be a hell of an achievement itself just being there when the virus dies off.
Hmm, why don't we all think of something for Lee?
Commandant, come on, throw some ideas out too.
Everyone begins chattering and imagining Lee with all sorts of strange Golden Age careers...
Lee should be a good fit for a doctor, right? Judging from his personality.
Even ignoring the kind of doctor, I don't have full medical training!
After the virus is gone, medical schools might become a thing again.
I wonder if they take Construct students...
But can't you just pop medical knowledge into your M.I.N.D. just like battle data...?
That's... true, but it'd be nice for everyone to sit in a classroom together, listening and learning, just like our mission report sessions, right?
Hmm, so maybe a job that's battle-related?
Someone like Quesada in Butch Quesada and the Moondance Angler, going guns akimbo?
That's not a job, that's just being a criminal.
When everything's over, and order is re-established, law will hold this society in place.
And if I'm still there for it, I don't want to do anything dangerous or risky ever again.
...I've never thought of this possibility, but it sounds surprisingly fitting...
Indeed. It's said that swimmers in the past mull over even the hydrodynamics of the body...
It does feel like something that Lee would spend a lot of time poring over.
Chrome's scythe flicks open in his hand almost instantly, and he throws it afar. Karenina lifts her bazooka and fires a barrage in the same direction.
The group immediately disperses 10 meters apart each other, and begin searching the area.
Lee is pointing at the ground. It is a trail of footprints smudged by a strange gel-like substance, covered by sand.
Liv leaned over and scanned the gelatinous substance.
...It's vital fluid, but it's kind of... unusual. This type of vital fluid comes from early Construct models in the Post-Pandemic Age.
But a lot of other materials were added to it, making it run at 50% efficiency of the fluid we currently use.
Commandant, I think we should go after whoever this is.
Whether friend or foe, this person cannot be left alone.
